definition: to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to argue endlessly/to try to have the last word

sentences.english: To argue otherwise is trying to defend the indefensible.
sentences.chinese: 持相反的论点就是试图为站不住脚的事情强辩。

sentences.english: Some may argue themselves out of trying their best by fantasing tomorrow's brightness.
sentences.chinese: 有些人强辩着把希望寄托于明日的光明而不努力。

definition: to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
to offer an explanation/to plead innocence/to try to defend oneself
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions/also written 振振有詞|振振有词
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to make false accusations against sb (idiom)
see 惱羞成怒|恼羞成怒[nao3 xiu1 cheng2 nu4]
